title: 2 Simple Ways to Bookmark a Website in Safari

steps.title: Open the Safari app.
steps.content: Open the Safari app. It's a blue and white app with a compass icon.

steps.title: Go to a web page.
steps.content: Go to a web page. Typically, bookmarks are used for web pages you visit frequently or want to remember so you can visit them again in the future. You can enter a website in the address bar or use Google Search to find it.

steps.title: Click Bookmarks in the menu bar.
steps.content: Click Bookmarks in the menu bar. You might also see "Bookmark" at the top of the screen—you can click on that to add your bookmark, as well. [1] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 February 2021. Alternatively, click the Share button in the top-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Add Bookmark….
steps.content: Click Add Bookmark… . This is in the drop-down menu. A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Name the bookmark (optional).
steps.content: Name the bookmark (optional). You can keep the auto-filled web page name or delete it and give it a name of your choice.

steps.title: Select a location for the bookmark.
steps.content: Select a location for the bookmark. You'll see a list of available folders under the "Add this page to" drop-down menu. To add a new folder, click Bookmarks in the menu bar, then click Add Bookmark Folder . This will add an "untitled folder" to the sidebar in Safari. Long-click the folder to edit the name.

steps.title: Click Add.
steps.content: Click Add . This will add the web page to your Mac's bookmarks. To access your bookmarks, click Bookmarks in the menu bar and click on the bookmark you want to open. Click Bookmarks in the menu bar and click Show Bookmarks to display the bookmarks sidebar. Click Bookmarks in the menu bar and click Edit Bookmarks to move, delete, or rename your bookmarks. You can also import bookmarks to Safari .

steps.title: Open the Safari app.
steps.content: Open the Safari app. It's a blue and white app with a compass icon.

steps.title: Go to a web page.
steps.content: Go to a web page. Typically, bookmarks are used for web pages you visit frequently or want to remember so you can revisit them in the future. You can enter a website in the address bar or enter keywords to search for one.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . This is the share button, and its icon is shaped like a box with an upward-pointing arrow. It's located at the bottom of the screen on an iPhone or in the upper-left on an iPad .

steps.title: Tap Add Bookmark.
steps.content: Tap Add Bookmark . It's a gray, open book icon at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Name the bookmark (optional).
steps.content: Name the bookmark (optional). You can keep the auto-filled Web page name or delete it and give it a name of your choice.

steps.title: Select a location for your bookmark.
steps.content: Select a location for your bookmark. A list of available folders is listed under the LOCATION section of the screen. Tap a location if you want to put your bookmark in a nested folder. If you want your bookmark listed in the top level of the directory, don't tap a folder. If you want to create a new bookmark folder , tap the Bookmarks icon in Safari. It's a blue outline of two curved pages. Then tap Edit in the corner of the screen, tap New Folder , type a name for the folder, and tap Bookmarks under location.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . It's in the upper-right corner of the screen. Your bookmark will be saved in the location you specified. To access your bookmarks, tap the Bookmarks icon in Safari, then tap the bookmark you want to open. To delete a bookmark, tap the Bookmarks icon in Safari, then tap Edit in the corner of the screen. Tap the red - next to the bookmark you want to delete, then tap Delete .
